title: Denmark Bans Civilian Drones Amid Security Concerns, Closes Airports
snippets: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.
Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders

Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions

Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Cope
This is the latest unexplained drone activity after several sightings, including over five Danish airports last week.
titles: Denmark bans drone flights after latest drone sightings at military bases
Denmark bans civil drones for a week after sightings over military bases
Denmark reports more drone sightings ahead of European summits
Denmark reports new drone sightings over army bases, NATO ups surveillance
summary: Recent drone activity, including sightings over five Danish airports, has prompted Denmark to temporarily close several airports and raise security concerns. Ahead of two European leaders' summits, the Danish government announced a ban on all civilian drone flights this week, especially after drones were observed at military sites. This measure aims to enhance security amid the unexplained drone incursions.

title: Red Roses Triumph at Rugby World Cup, Beat Canada at Battersea Celebration
snippets: Rain could not England marked their World Cup win with a celebration event at Battersea Power Station

Strength in depth was key, with 32 players contributing in a tournament in which John Mitchell’s side were rarely troubled

Hannah Botterman Bristol Bears Wanted to prove she is the best loosehead prop in the world and duly delivered. England at times would have bee
In 2017 and 2022 England's Red Roses suffered crushing Rugby World Cup final defeats. On Saturday, they banished those demons to clinch final success over Canada.
titles: England fans soak up celebrations as Red Roses mark Women’s Rugby World Cup triumph
England squad ratings: how all the Red Roses performed at Rugby World Cup
How England's Red Roses banished Rugby World Cup final demons
summary: England's Red Roses celebrated their Rugby World Cup victory at Battersea Power Station, overcoming previous final defeats in 2017 and 2022 by winning against Canada on Saturday. The team's depth, with 32 players participating, played a crucial role in their largely untroubled tournament performance. Hannah Botterman, from Bristol Bears, stood out by proving herself as the world's best loosehead prop.

title: Zelenskyy Reports 500 Drones in Heavy Attack on Ukraine
snippets: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the large-scale attacks involved nearly 500 strike drones.
Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.
Russia’s missile and drone attack came days after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s meeting with President Donald Trump at the U.N. General Assembly.
titles: Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10
Heavy Russian drone attack kills at least four in Ukraine’s capital Kyiv
Four dead as massive Russian attack on Kyiv hits apartments, hospital
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reported nearly 500 strike drones were used in one of the heaviest attacks on Ukraine since the war began. This information is supported by media reports and independent monitors, highlighting the scale of the assault.

title: Hovland Withdraws from Ryder Cup, Singles Match Halved Due to Injury
snippets: Viktor Hovland's Ryder Cup singles match against Harris English is declared a half point for Europe and the US.

Norway's Viktor Hovland withdrew from the Ryder Cup on Sunday with a neck injury, a move that lifted Europe closer to a historic victory over the United States at Bethpage Black."There's nothing more I would like to do than be out there representing Team Europe and trying to help them win the R

Viktor Hovland withdrew from his singles match Sunday in the Ryder Cup, which also meant Harris English had an early end to his week.  Hovland and English were scheduled to meet in the final match.  Under the captain's agreement, that will be considered a halve.
The U.S. and Europe will be treated as a tie and each team will receive half a point.
The Norwegian last played in the final morning match on Saturday.
Before even a single ball was hit on Sunday at the Ryder Cup, Team Europe inched slightly closer to victory.
titles: Injured Hovland ruled out of Ryder Cup singles
Injured Hovland withdraws from Ryder Cup as Europe moves closer to win
Viktor Hovland out of Ryder Cup singles with injury. Harris English has to sit
Ryder Cup: Europe's Viktor Hovland forced to withdraw from Sunday singles with a neck injury
Viktor Hovland injury update: Golfer scratched from Sunday singles at Ryder Cup with neck soreness
Viktor Hovland withdraws from Ryder Cup, moving Europe closer to victory
summary: Viktor Hovland withdrew from the Ryder Cup due to a neck injury, resulting in his singles match against Harris English being declared a half point for both Europe and the US. This decision, made before play on Sunday, moved Europe closer to a historic victory at Bethpage Black. Hovland last competed on Saturday, and his withdrawal marked an early conclusion to English's participation in the event.

title: UK Backs £1.5bn Loan for JLR to Recover from Cyber-Attack, Restart Production
snippets: Liam Byrne spoke after the government announced it was backing a £1.5bn loan to the company, and warned cyber-attacks could become more common.
Carmaker receives official backing after cyber attack that has halted production

Britain’s largest automotive employer plans to restart engine manufacturing in early October, report says

The government has said it will underwrite a £1.5bn loan guarantee to Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) as the carmaker battles the consequences of a recent cyber-attack.

JLR had to suspend
titles: Jaguar Land Rover may need more than £1.5bn government loan guarantee, MP says
‘Moral hazard’ warning after £1.5bn government loan guarantee for JLR
UK government will underwrite £1.5bn loan guarantee to Jaguar Land Rover after cyber-attack
summary: The UK government has underwritten a £1.5bn loan guarantee to Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), Britain's largest automotive employer, to help it recover from a cyber-attack and restart engine manufacturing in early October. This move, involving a loan from a commercial bank backed by UK Export Finance, aims to protect the automotive supply chain and provide certainty to suppliers.

title: Stampede at Tamil Nadu Rally for Actor Vijay Kills 39, Injures 40
snippets: A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.
A crowd crush at a campaign rally for popular actor-turned-politician Vijay has killed at least 39 people in Karur.
Crush at actor-politician Vijay’s rally in Tamil Nadu kills 39 people, including eight children; 40 others injured.
The stampede took place at an event for Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, the popular actor known professionally as Vijay.
titles: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
Crowd crush kills dozens in India at political rally for Tamil actor Vijay
Crowd crush at political rally in southern India kills 39 people
Stampede at Actor’s Political Rally Kills at Least 38 in India
summary: A stampede at a campaign rally in Tamil Nadu for actor-turned-politician Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, known as Vijay, resulted in at least 39 deaths, including eight children, and injured 40 others. The incident occurred in Karur during an event for the popular Indian actor and politician.

SANTA BARBARA, Calif. (AP) — Selena Gomez has married music producer and songwriter Benny Blanco, announcing the news in an Instagram post showing the couple kissing and embracing on a lawn. “My wife in real life,” Blanco responded to the post Saturday by the Grammy- and Emmy-nominated performer. The ceremony was attended by celebrities including Taylor Swift and Paul Rudd. Blanco and Gomez shared their joy on Instagram, with Blanco referring to Gomez as "my wife in real life."

title: Gaza Health Ministry: 66,000 Palestinians Dead in Israel-Hamas War
snippets: The death toll in the Israel-Hamas war has topped 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry said, a day before the Israeli Prime Minister heads for talks with U.S. President Donald Trump.

CAIRO (AP) — The death toll in the Israel-Hamas war has topped 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza’s Health Ministry said Sunday, a day before Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu heads to the White House for talks with U.S. President Donald Trump on halting Israel’s ongoing offensive in Gaza City. Israe
titles: Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump
Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump
summary: The Gaza Health Ministry reports over 66,000 Palestinians have died in the Israel-Hamas war. This announcement comes as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu prepares for discussions with U.S. President Donald Trump aimed at stopping Israel's offensive in Gaza City.

title: President Orders Troops to Portland to Guard Immigration Sites
snippets: US President Donald Trump claimed that Antifa is waging "war" on the famously progressive city. Portland's mayor has rejected these claims.
Trump directs troops to Portland with "full force" directive &n
President Trump on Saturday said he ordered the deployment of troops to Portland to combat alleged domestic terrorists.
titles: Trump sends troops to Portland over 'domestic terrorists'
Trump directs troops to Portland with "full force" directive - Axios
Trump admin live updates: Gov. says 'no need' after Trump directs troops to Portland
summary: The president has directed troops to Portland with a "full force" directive, stating it is necessary to protect immigration detention facilities from what he terms "domestic terrorists." This action is part of a broader initiative to address security concerns at these facilities.

title: Ryder Cup Announcer Resigns, Apologizes for McIlroy Chant Incident
snippets: A master of ceremonies has stepped down from her role at the Ryder Cup after joining the Bethpage Black crowd in directing expletive-laced chants toward Rory McIlroy.
The Ryder Cup first-tee announcer who encouraged expletive-filled chants at Rory McIlroy has apologised and stepped down, the PGA of America has confirmed.
titles: Bethpage MC steps down over vulgar Rory chants
Ryder Cup MC steps down after encouraging expletive-filled Rory chants
summary: The first-tee announcer at the Ryder Cup, who prompted the crowd to chant expletives at Rory McIlroy, has apologized and resigned from her role, as confirmed by the PGA of America.

title: West Revives UN Resolutions Against Iran; Inflation, Shortages Plague Nation
snippets: Six UN resolutions against Iran are automatically revived by the West as Iran and Russia call the move 'null and void'.
Already suffering a 40 percent inflation rate and critical shortages of power and water, many in Iran expect conditions to get worse.
titles: Iranians fear more economic pain, war as UN sanctions snapback
Iranians Brace for Economic Impact of New U.N. Sanctions
summary: The West has revived six UN resolutions against Iran, a move that Iran and Russia deem 'null and void'. Amidst this, Iran is grappling with a 40 percent inflation rate and severe shortages of power and water, with the populace bracing for worsening conditions.

Starmer urges Labour to unite for ‘fight of our lives’ ahead of conference
summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer criticized Nigel Farage's Reform UK party's main anti-immigration policy as "racist." Starmer emphasized the need for discipline within his center-left Labour Party amid polls indicating Farage's party is leading.

title: Kyiv Hit by Over 600 Drones and Missiles; Casualties Reported

titles: Zelensky condemns 'vile' Russian strikes lasting 12 hours

Concurrently, unidentified drones were observed over Danish military bases. At the UN General Assembly, Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov issued a warning against aggression towards Russia.

title: Global Warming Intensifies Droughts; Liverpool Suffers Season's First Loss
snippets:
Rising global temperatures are making dry spells longer and more intense, with profound effects on health, food and the economy

Drought is a “creeping disaster” that devastates regions in slow motion. It kills livestock, ruins harvests, and has knock-on effects across the economy that force
Liverpool suffered its first loss of the season as Crystal Palace exposed some of the weaknesses in the defending Premier League champions.
titles: What are droughts and how worried should we be about them?
How Worried Should Arne Slot Be By Liverpool’s First Loss?
summary: Global temperatures are increasing, leading to longer and more intense droughts. These conditions have significant impacts on health, food security, and economies by killing livestock, ruining crops, and causing widespread economic disruptions. Concurrently, Liverpool experienced its first defeat of the season against Crystal Palace, highlighting vulnerabilities in the team's defense as the current Premier League champions.
